alert.note: Alert for South Central Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 03 at 5:25PM PST until January 05 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Medford OR has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Oregon... South Fork Coquille River at Myrtle Point affecting South Central Oregon Coast zone. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...South Fork Coquille River at Myrtle Point. * WHEN...From this evening to Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 30.0 feet, Agricultural and pasture land begins to flood. Impacts on cattle grazing are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:20 PM PST Monday the stage was 18.5 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached based on the latest forecast information. - Flood stage is 33.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday afternoon at 1000 AM PST.
